intro: Hieracium ulotetodes, commonly known as the woolly hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy, rough stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a flat-topped cluster, typical of the daisy family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows and grassy areas. Hieracium ulotetodes is an herbaceous perennial that thrives in temperate climates.
